body:

Appears as an inverted golden [[pyramid (geometry)|]] when completed. It was completed by [[muto yugi|Muto Yugi]], who later gained his "other self" ([[yami yugi|Yami Yugi]] i.e. the soul of Atem) in the process.

body:

She has [[purple eyes]] with [[star-shaped pupils]] and [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] stylized with a [[one side up]], [[hair between eyes]], [[swept bangs]], and [[sidelocks]]. She is usually depicted wearing a [[rabbit hair ornament]], [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[pink dress]] with a [[heart brooch]], [[frilled_gloves|frilled]] [[pink gloves]], and [[pink footwear|pink]] [[thigh boots]].

She and [[pose_imitation|other characters]] are frequently drawn in one of her [[Hoshino Ai's pose|signature poses]].

She is voiced by [[Takahashi Rie]] (JPN) and Donna Bella Litton (ENG).

body:

A move in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]][/i] media.

In the games/manga/anime, this move usually appears in the form of psychic waves striking the opponent.

Sometimes this move is used to lift something with the power of one's mind.

title: mother_1
body:
The first game in [[mother (series)|MOTHER/EarthBound]] [[tag group:role-playing games|role-playing game]] series from [[Nintendo]] by [[Itoi Shigesato]], released for the [[Famicom|Family Computer]] on July 27, 1989.

This game was translated but unreleased in North America for some time, leaving a prototype. On June 20, 2003, this game was re-released in Japan for the [[Game Boy Advance]] along with [[MOTHER 2]] in a 2-in-1 game, [i]MOTHER 1+2[/i]. On June 14, 2015, the translated version was released internationally under the title [i]EarthBound Beginnings[/i].

h4. Characters

* [[Ninten]]
** [[Ken (Mother)|]]: Manga Counterpart
* [[Lloyd (Mother)|]]
* [[Ana (Mother)|]]
* [[Teddy (Mother)|]]
* [spoiler][[Giygas]][/spoiler]

h4. External Links

* "EarthBound Fandom Entry":[https://earthbound.fandom.com/wiki/EarthBound_Beginnings]

title: touhou_mother
body:
A [[crossover]] fangame of the [[Touhou]] and [[Mother (series)|]] series made by "S-Tel (E-HERO S-Chan)":[http://shijimisenmustdie.blog.fc2.com/] in [[rpg maker|RPG Maker 2000]], first posted in "video format":[https://www.nicovideo.jp/mylist/6568118] on [[niconico]] before it was actually released in April 2009.  

It's an ordinary day in [[Gensokyo]], which is to say that everyone's bored. [[Hakurei Reimu]] and [[Kirisame Marisa]] head out to visit [[Kazami Yuuka]], and while dealing with a [[cirno|fairy]] problem, they hear a loud crash. Nearby, they find a [[meteor]]ite, an [[starman (mother)|alien]], and a [[porky minch|certain boy]] who's wandered into their world...

[[Kirai Shouen]] is credited to have redrawn every sprites in this game.

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Touhou Mother":[https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Touhou_Mother]
* "NicoNicoPedia: 東方星母録":[https://dic.nicovideo.jp/a/東方星母録]
* "Game Translation by VGPerson":[https://vgperson.com/games/touhoumother.htm]

title: ambush
body:
An [b]ambush[/b] is a [[battle]] tactic where a character takes advantage of concealment or the [[surprised|element of surprise]] to [[attack]] unsuspecting characters from [[hiding|concealed]] positions, such as among dense underbrush or behind [[hill]]tops. Sometimes, an ambush can involve the exclusive or combined use of [[explosive|improvised explosive devices]], that allow the attacking characters to hit the targeted characters while minimizing the risk of being exposed to return fire.

In most [[tag group:role-playing games|RPG games]], an ambush will forbid all player actions, allowing the enemy to act first (example of indications: [[red theme|red swirl]] in [[mother (series)|MOTHER/EarthBound]], swapped positions in [[Final Fantasy]]).

h4. See also

* [[surprised]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Ambush":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ambush]

title: michael_keaton
body:
Michael John Douglas (born September 5, 1951), known professionally as Michael Keaton, is an American actor.
Keaton gained early recognition for his comedic roles in Night Shift (1982), Mr. Mom (1983), and [[Beetlejuice]] (1988). He gained wider stardom portraying the title superhero in [[Batman (1989)]] and [[Batman Returns]] (1992). 

Keaton experienced a career resurgence after taking a starring role as a faded actor attempting a comeback in Alejandro González Iñárritu's Birdman (2014), for which he won a Golden Globe Award for Best Actor and a nomination for the Academy Award for Best Actor. He has since acted in biographical dramas such as Spotlight (2015), The Founder (2016), The Trial of the Chicago 7 (2020), and Worth (2021). He portrayed the [[vulture (marvel)|Vulture]] in [[Spider-Man: Homecoming]] (2017)  and [[Morbius (film)|Morbius]] (2022) while also reprising his roles as [[Batman]] in [[The Flash (movie)|]], and the title role in [[Beetlejuice Beetlejuice]] (2024).

title: the_suicide_squad_(2021_movie)
body:
2021 [[DC Comics]] movie directed by James Gunn. Based on a comic book series of the same name.
In the film, several convicts join a task force known as the "Suicide Squad" in exchange for lighter sentences. They are sent to the South American island nation of Corto Maltese to destroy all traces of the giant alien starfish Starro the Conqueror before it falls into the local government's control.

Not to be confused with [[Suicide Squad|the other similarly named movie]].

title: shendyt
body: A kilt-like garment [[ancient egyptian clothes|worn in Ancient Egypt.]] It was made of cloth and was worn around the waist, typically extending to above the knees. Shendyts are depicted on pharaohs, deities, and commoners in a variety of situations in Egyptian artwork.

title: nemes
body:
The nemes is the striped headcloth worn by [[pharaoh]]s in ancient Egypt. It covered the whole crown and back of the head and nape of the neck (sometimes also extending a little way down the back) and had lappets, two large flaps which hung down behind the ears and in front of both shoulders. - [i]from "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nemes [/i]

h4. See also

title: annet_myer
body:
Fictional female character and main protagonist of the 2D side-scrolling [[fantasy]] action [[video game]] [[El Viento]] released in 1991 for the [[Sega Mega Drive]].

[b]Annet Myer[/b] is a [[Peru]] [[Incan]] sorceress skilled with the use of bladed boomerangs and magical spells. Her name in Spanish (the actual language used in [[Peru]]) is more correctly spelled [b]Anita Mier[/b].

title: peru
body:
A country in the South American continent. 

It is a megadiverse country with habitats ranging from the arid plains of the Pacific coastal region in the west to the peaks of the Andes mountains extending from the north to the southeast of the country to the tropical Amazon Basin rainforest in the east with the Amazon river.

It was home to several ancient cultures. Ranging from the Norte Chico civilization starting in 3500 BCE, the oldest civilization in the Americas and one of the five cradles of civilization, to the Inca Empire.

Its official language is [[spanish_text|Spanish]] and Quechua.

h4.See also

* [[Peru]]
* [[Incan]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Peru":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peru

title: fad_assault_rifle
body:
The [b]FAD[/b], also known as [b]Dual Automatic Rifle[/b] (Spanish: [i][b]F[/b]usil [b]A[/b]utomático [b]D[/b]oble[/i]) is an advanced [[Peru]] automatic weapon designed in 2008 by Salomón Braga Lozo of [i]SIMA Electronica[/i], a division of the state owned SIMA (Spanish: [i]Servicio Industrial de la Marina[/i]) shipyards, based in the port of "Callao":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Callao , [[Peru]].

The FAD is a futuristic looking [[assault rifle]] centered around the NATO 5.56x45mm cartridge that offers low recoil, low weight and volume while at the same time giving precision, adequate range and ergonomy coupled with a "pump-action" type 40 mm grenade launcher in a single package. It is also a light "Bullpup" rifle that can easily be used as a back-up weapon by armored crews.

title: falke_(signalis)
body:
Replika Type FLKR (Führrungs Kommando Leiteinheit Replika | Operational Command Control Unit Replica) | Falke

The [[Falke_(Signalis) | Falke]] (Falcon in German.) is a character / unit in the game [[Signalis]]. 

Falke's are commander units meant to lead the security forces in the facilities in the Signalis universe, whether it be prison, mining, research or any other type of facility used by the Eusan Nation. They are typically perceived as godlike beings towards other Replika units, solidifying their status as commanders or leaders within their facilities.

In the game, the player encounters a comatose Falke during their playthrough.

Gameplay Spoilers :

[spoilers] Later in the game, the facility's Falke will awaken and you will need to fight them to continue the story. [/spoilers]

h6. Appearance
On top of being an [[android]], the Falke unit has in terms of notable visual traits, the following : [[Very long hair | Very long]], [[black_hair | black hair]], [[Blue_Eyes|blue eyes]], a half golden [[Laurel_Crown|laurel crown]] as a [[Hair_Ornament|hair ornament]] and [[forehead_mark | three marks]] on their forehead. 
Clothing wise, the Falke unit wears a black {{bodysuit}} with golden ornaments. Most notably golden rings on the leg and arm parts and the symbols on the right side of their torso.

title: x-men_film_series
body:
X-Men is an American superhero film series based on the [[Marvel]] Comics [[X-men|superhero team of the same name]]. [[20th_century_studios|20th Century Fox]] obtained the film rights to the team and other related characters in 1994 for $2.6 million. After numerous drafts, Bryan Singer was hired to direct the first film, released in 2000.

[[Deadpool & Wolverine]] (2024) integrates [[Deadpool]] from Fox's X-Men film series in the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]] and retains the R rating of the previous films, making it the first MCU film to have such a rating.

h4. Entries

h6. Original trilogy

* [[X-Men (2000)]]
* [[X2 (2003)]]
* [[X-Men: The Last Stand]] (2006)

h6. Wolverine trilogy

* [[X-Men Origins: Wolverine]] (2009)
* [[The Wolverine]] (2013)
* [[Logan (movie)|]] (2017)

h6. Prequel films

* [[X-Men: First Class]] (2011)
* [[X-Men: Days of Future Past]] (2014)
* [[X-Men: Apocalypse]] (2016)
* X-Men: Dark Phoenix (2019)

h6. Deadpool duology

* [[Deadpool (movie)|]] (2016)
* [[Deadpool 2]] (2018)

h6. Spinoffs

* [[The New Mutants]] (2020)

title: tre_kronor
body:
"Tre kronor" translates to "Three Crowns" and is Sweden's heraldic national symbol with a long history. It is used in the [[coat of arms]]/[[logo]] of many governmental branches.

It consists of three three-peaked crowns in an equilateral triangle, with two on top and one in the bottom. The most common shape of the insignia is that of a shield, but the air force uses a round version on their vehicles, in which case there is a border in the same colour as the crowns. In its base form, the crowns are yellow on a blue fill. On military vehicles colourless versions are often used, with black (or dark grey) crowns and border with no fill, which is used on bright surfaces, or a white fill with black or transparent crowns and no border, used on darker surfaces. Very old army vehicles can be seen in pictures and museums painted with a rectangular version of the insignia in the latter colour scheme. However, the rectangular insignia was eventually dropped in favour of painting the [[Swedish flag]] instead.

h4. See also

* [[Swedish air force]]
* [[Sweden]]
* [[Swedish uniform]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Three_Crowns

title: k9_(dog)
body:
A K9 or K-9 are specifically trained [[dog]]s to assist [[police|law enforcement]] and [[military]] personnel.  They're trained to assist in various duties, such as searching for drugs and explosives, locating missing or wounded people, finding crime scene evidence, protecting officers and other people, detecting enemy or intruders, and chasing and subduing fleeing suspects.

The breeds most commonly used by law enforcement and the military are the [[German Shepherd]], Belgian Malinois, Bloodhound, Dutch Shepherd, and [[Labrador Retriever]].  [[Rottweiler]] and Doberman Pinscher were also common breeds early on, but have since fallen out of favor.

h4. Examples

title: qingque_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]].

An average Diviner of the Divination Commission on the Xianzhou Luofu, and a librarian. She never slacks off when it comes to slacking off and is about to be demoted to a "door guardian." 

Fights using [[Mahjong tile]]s.

h4. Appearance
* !post #7690418: Splash art

h4. Profile
[expand]
An average Diviner of the Divination Commission, who will never slack off when it comes to slacking off.

She passed the Divination Commissions entrance exam to please her parents, only to discover what she had originally thought to be a relaxing public servant job to instead be very intensive and a worker's nightmare.

After several years of experience, Qingque had finally honed her craft — No matter which department she changes to, she remains the lowest level of Diviners.

"When there's nothing else left to do, why not bury your head in a book or play cards? What more could I ask for"
[/expand]

h4. See Also
* [[Qingque (Lucky Snack) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Ruan Mei's creations: Lucky Snack]]

title: koyanskaya_(fate)
body:
Alter Ego-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]].

Koyanskaya is originally introduced as Tamamo Vitch, one of the Tamamo Nine. [[Shi Huang Di (fate)|]] also calls her "Da Ji", a Chinese figure who ruined dynasties.

[spoilers]However, Koyanskaya actually has no real True Name to speak of, and is entirely unrelated to either the Tamamo Nine or Da Ji. Koyanskaya is "the Tunguska event given form", the embodiment of the thoughts of animals persecuted by mankind, and chose to manifest in the Saint Graph of Tamamo no Mae due to their shared attribute of being a "beast that is supposed to live for revenge against humans." She likens herself to "the Tamamo no Mae from another world," considering Tamamo to be her original, but she's not actually Tamamo nor is she part of the Tamamo Nine.

She was given the name Yaskaya by the manifested Heroic Spirit [[dobrynya nikitich (fate)|Dobrynya Nikitich]], which she later mistakenly remembered as Koyanskaya. This is an allusion to the Shinto goddess [[Konohanasakuya-hime (mythology)|]], to which Koyanskaya has no relation  whatsoever.

When she was defeated in her Beast form, she split into two distinct but similar fragments, Koyanskaya of Light and Koyanskaya of Darkness, in a contrast akin to yin and yang.[/spoilers]

She has been released as an Assassin class Servant in Fate/Grand Order under the name "Koyanskaya of Light", and shortly afterwards as a Foreigner class Servant under the name "Koyanskaya of Darkness".

title: konohanasakuya-hime_(mythology)
body:
(Konohana Sakuya-Hime, lit. Princess Blossoming Flower of the Tree)

A goddess in [[Japanese mythology]]. Her name was described as 木花之佐久夜毘売 (Konohana no Sakuya-Bime) in the "Kojiki.":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kojiki 

She and her sister, Iwanaga-hime (Stone Longevity Princess) are the daughters of the mountain god Ohoyamatsumi. The mythology about them and "Ninigi-no-Mikoto":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ninigi-no-Mikoto is considered as a variation of "”the Stone and the Banana.”":http://www.mircea-eliade.com/from-primitives-to-zen/069.html Later she became associated with [[Mount Fuji]].

[[Konohana Sakuya (persona)|]], [[Amagi Yukiko]]'s persona in [[Persona 4]] was named after this goddess.

h4.See also

* Wikipedia: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Konohanasakuya-hime

title: persona_4
body:
A Playstation 2 RPG and part of the [[Persona]] series of the [i][[Shin Megami Tensei]][/i] franchise, released 10 July 2008 in Japan, 9 December 2008 in North America and 13 March 2009 in Europe.

The game follows a [[Narukami Yuu|high school junior]] who, due to his parents' work overseas, moves from the city to the rural town of Inaba to live for a year with his uncle and local policeman [[Doujima Ryoutarou]] and his six-year-old daughter Nanako. With his new friends from the local high school, he investigates a series of inexplicable murders and the truth about a TV channel that only appears during midnight, armed with Personas, materialized aspects of their personalities.

Received a enhanced port on the [[Playstation Vita]], and later [[Microsoft Windows]], [[Xbox One]], [[Xbox Series X]] and S and [[Nintendo Switch]], entitled [i][[Persona 4 the Golden]][/i]. It is set in the same universe as its predecessor, [[Persona 3]]. A fighting game, [[Persona 4: The Ultimate in Mayonaka Arena]], also acts as a direct sequel to the game.

Another spinoff is the novel [[Persona X Detective]], taking place 1 year after the events of Persona 4.

title: yunjian
body: A yunjian is an ornate [[Chinese clothes|traditional Chinese]] collar. It translates to cloud collar; its namesake derives from its dulating trim, of which is often cloud-like in design. It is sometimes also made to resemble feathers. The yunjian also often features [[print collar|elaborate print]] designs, and sometimes features several [[tassel]]s. The collar was popular during the [[ming_dynasty|Ming]] and [[qing_dynasty|Qing]] dynasties, and was mostly used during [[Chinese wedding|weddings]] and banquets. h4. Examples * !post #5396498 * !post #7401733 h4. External links "Wikipedia: Yunjian":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yunjian]

It has 2 different styles, one being a [[white leotard]] and the other being a [[white tube top]] with a [[white skirt|white]] [[frilled skirt]], it comes with a [[pink jacket]], [[white gloves|white]] [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[elbow gloves]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[thigh boots]].

She has 2 different [[official alternate hairstyle|hairstyles]] in this outfit, she has either [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair|pink]]/[[purple hair|purple]] [[streaked hair]] tied into [[twintails]] done or she wears her hair in a [[two side up]]-fashion.

title: karenina:_ember_(pgr)
body:
A frame of [[Karenina (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], [[cyborg]] in appearance.

h4. Appearance
Ember frame of Karenina has [[orange eyes]] and [[white hair|white]]/[[blonde hair]]. Her hair style has [[twin drills]], [[swept bangs]] and [[sidelocks]] incorporated into the style, overall length is [[medium hair|medium]]. Features various [[hair ornament]]s, black diamonds on her bangs, [[mechabare|mechanical]] [[radio antenna]] is sometimes depicted as it is introduced by high awakening level of the frame. All four limbs are mechanical with [[robot joints|robotic (hinge) joints]], left [[mechanical arms]] connects just above the elbow while the right connects at the shoulder, both of her [[mechanical legs]] likely connects at her hips. Other notable components includes [[mechanical spine]] and mechanical [[breastplate]]. Has three black [[earclip]]s on her left ear.

Ember frame wears a [[two-tone dress|two tone]] [[backless dress]], made up a [[black dress|black]] [[reflective clothes|reflective]] fabric on the right laying over a [[white dress|white]] [[pleated dress|pleated]] patterned fabric on the left, featuring a [[see-through dress|see-through window]] of [[underboob cutout]], fitted with many [[yellow ribbon|yellow]] and [[orange ribbon|orange ribbon]]s.

She uses a [[cannon]] barrel as her weapon.

h4. List of Alternate Coatings ([[official alternate costume|alternative costumes]])
* [[karenina: ember (deed of snow leopard) (pgr)|Deed of Snow Leopard]]
* [[karenina: ember (tulle redbud) (pgr)|Tulle Redbud]]
* [[karenina: ember (machina) (pgr)|Machina]]
* [[karenina: ember (bloody love) (pgr)|Bloody Love]]
* [[karenina: ember (gray feathers: ember) (pgr)|Gray Feathers: Ember]]
* [[karenina: ember (silver white) (pgr)|Silver White]]

h4. External links
* "GrayRavens wiki - Karenina: Ember Gallery":[https://grayravens.com/wiki/Karenina:_Ember/Gallery]

title: cinderelik_(pgr)
body:
Cinderelik the Orphan, a recurring antagonist NPC from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]]. She is an Ascendent of the Ascension Network, her unconditioned loyalty to [[Vonnegut (pgr)|]] seems to be linked to her pursuit of her 'mother'.

Cinderelik has the appearance of an [[expressionless]] young girl with [[orange eyes]], [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]] and [[orange hair|orange]] [[streaked hair|streaks]]. Wears a [[black dress]] and has a [[single wing|single]] [[mechanical wings|mechanical wing]].

title: watanabe_(pgr)
body:
A playable character of [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], Watanabe is the leader of the Forsaken, a paramilitary faction that is hostile to Babylonia and the World Government, considered fugitives by the latter two. Voiced by Yoshimasa Hosoya.

h4. Appearance
Watanabe has [[medium hair|medium length]] [[grey hair]], he has [[heterochromia]] eyes, left eye is [[blue eyes|blue]] while his right is a different colour, usually [[yellow eyes|yellow]], he also has a [[barcode tattoo]] on his forehead. [[dual wielding|Dual wields]] a pair of [[dagger]]s/[[machete]]s as his weapons.

h4. List of playable frames of Watanabe
* [[Watanabe: Nightblade (pgr)|]]
* [[Watanabe: Astral (pgr)|]]
* [[Watanabe: Epitaph (pgr)|]] <tn>*Name subject to change upon global release</tn>

title: watanabe:_astral_(pgr)
body:
A frame of [[Watanabe (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], [[cyborg]] in appearance.

h4. Appearance
An alternative frame for Watanabe, designed for piloting high altitude aircrafts, similar designs to a [[pilot suit]]. His Astral frame is mostly black and grey in coloration, has features such as a [[chest harness]], [[pouch]]/[[belt pouch]]es and [[mechabare]]. His [[medium hair|medium length]] [[grey hair]] is more naturally presented, his [[hair between eyes|bangs falls between his eyes]], covering his forehead barcode, and he has a short [[low ponytail]].

He has [[heterochromia]] eyes, [[blue eyes|blue left]] and [[yellow eyes|yellow right]], a [[bandaid on cheek|bandaid on right cheek]].

h4. List of Alternate Coatings ([[official alternate costume|alternative costumes]])
* [[watanabe: astral (field training) (pgr)|Field Training]]

title: martin_(pgr)
body:
Martin is a 'Bionic', a sentient war machine developed by the ARU. Martin is a Bionic based on a [[polar bear]], though the anatomy proportions are modified for bipedal movements. During the event of 'Firn Night', Martin together with [[Nanami (pgr)|]] played a key role in securing the victory for the ARU and Babylonia forces.

Though his name is Martin, Nanami addresses him with a wide variety of names such as and not limited to: Matty, Martini, Morley, Morty.

title: nanami:_starfarer_(pgr)
body:
A frame of [[Nanami (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]].

h4. Appearance
Starfarer frame has [[grey eyes]], [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] in a [[bob cut]] style on the front and a left [[side ponytail|side ponytail]], hair ornament is a black [[circlet]]. She wears a white and grey [[pilot suit]] with an [[backless outfit|backless design]], also featuring [[gold trim]] design and [[high heels|high heeled footwear]]. Some times depicted with gold [[tiara]] decorated with wings.

Her [[externally piloted mecha]] is named [[Power (pgr)|]].

h4. List of Alternate Coatings ([[official alternate costume|alternative costumes]])
* [[nanami: starfarer (night navigator) (pgr)|Night Navigator]]

h4. External links
* "GrayRavens wiki - Nanami: Starfarer Gallery":[https://grayravens.com/wiki/Nanami:_Starfarer/Gallery]

title: power_(pgr)
body:
[[nanami (pgr)|Nanami]]'s [[externally_piloted_mecha|externally piloted mecha]] used by her [[nanami: starfarer (pgr)|Starfarer]] frame.

Featuring shoulder rocket launch [[missile pod|pods]], [[pile bunker]] on the right arm and a foldable [[chainsword]] on the left.  In the [[nanami: starfarer (night navigator) (pgr)|Night Navigator]] skin, Power takes on a 21st century space vehicle theme akin to the ISS/NASA, but the mechanical parts function and bodily aspects remains the same.

title: diana_(pgr)
body:
Diana is a member of the Forest Guards of the Arctic Route Union, a military <spoilers>penal</spoilers> unit made up of advanced quadrupedal Constructs. <spoilers>Since Rosetta's departure for Babylonia, Diana has taking up the leadership role within the Forest Guards.</spoilers>

h5. Appearance
Diana is [[cyborg]] and [[taur]] / [[centauroid]] in appearance and has very little biological features below her head, she has [[aqua eyes]] and [[grey hair]], overall hair length is [[long hair|long]], hair style is similar to [[hime cut]], [[straight hair]] with [[blunt bangs]], [[sidelocks]] with [[blunt ends]].

Possible tags include: [[Antlers]] / [[Fake antlers]], [[Headgear]], [[Chin guard]]. [[Metal collar]], [[Bodysuit]] / [[Impossible bodysuit]] / [[Skin tight]], [[Cloak]], [[Mechabare]], [[Earrings]] , [[Polearm]]

title: vanessa_(pgr)
body:
Vanessa is the taskforce human Commandant of Babylonia's Egret team, consist of Construct [[bambinata (pgr)|Bambinata]] and <spoiler>formerly</spoiler> [[Teasell (pgr)|]].

h5. Appearance:
Vanessa has [[purple eyes]] and [[white hair]] in a [[bob cut]] style, styled with three [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]]s on each side, totalling to six. She is sometimes depicted with a [[print eyepatch]] <spoilers>to cover up her blind eye and [[scar on face|scars on her face]] she received in combat, during the events of chapter 17 The Surviving Lucem</spoilers>.

title: teasell_(pgr)
body:
Teasell, a NPC from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]]. He is a <spoiler>former</spoiler> member of [[Vanessa (pgr)|]]'s Egret squadron of Babylonia.

Teasell is tall and his body shape is [[toned male|toned]], has [[long hair|long]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[white hair]] in a [[low-tied long hair|low-tied]] style. Has [[red eyes]] and [[red eyeshadow]], left arm is [[mechanical arms|mechanical]] ([[single mechanical arm]]).

He wears a [[skin tight]] [[bodysuit]] with a [[blue sleeves|blue sleeve]] ([[single detached sleeve]]) on his right arm, left shoulder is [[shoulder armor|armored]] ([[igote]]).

title: trailblazer_(pgr)
body:
Trailblazer (Also known as Radiant Marcher) is a NPC, enemy boss and a limited time playable character from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], a mechanoid associated with the Church of Machina, and the current holder of the title 'Chariot'.

A [[mecha]] [[robot]], body painted primarily in white, black and red, gold accented trims in various locations. Has four arms ([[extra arms]]), a pair of smaller and more humanoid appearance arms growing out of the torso, and a pair of larger mechanised arms on the shoulder. Uses a pair of [[energy sword]]s in combat.

title: signa_(pgr)
body:
An in game item from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], exclusively designed for [[Alisa (pgr)|]] ([[Alisa: echo (pgr)|Echo]] frame).

A girl wearing [[white tank top]] and [[white skirt|white]] [[miniskirt]] with [[side slit]]s, seen using a [[zweihander]] with balance scales hanging from the guard. Has [[very long hair|very long]] [[blonde hair]] with [[green eyes]].

h5. External Link
* "GrayRavens wiki - Signa":[https://grayravens.com/wiki/Signa]

title: tifa_(pgr)
body:
Tifa was a Construct in service to Babylonia's Task Force Suzaku, her team was defeated and her Commandant was killed prior to the story. <spoilers>She was captured and rebuilt by the Ascendant [[Roland (pgr)|]], turned into the enemy boss unit '[[Iron Maiden (pgr)|]]'</spoilers>. Her memory was recovered and recorded, designed to be used exclusively for Vera's [[vera: garnet (pgr)|Garnet]] frame.

A support type Construct, she uses two [[floating weapon|floating]] [[energy gun]]s in combat, her uniform consist of a [[grey dress|grey]] [[collared dress]], [[grey capelet|grey]] and [[red capelet]], [[black gloves]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] and [[red eyes]], her [[headgear]] has the appearance of a [[spiked headband]].

h4. Official arts
* !post #4622298: Memory slot 1 and 4
* !post #4622301: Memory slot 2 and 5
* !post #4622299: Memory slot 3 and 6

title: iron_maiden_(pgr)
body:
Enemy boss unit from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], the rebuilt ([[dark persona]]) form of [[Tifa (pgr)|]]. As her codename suggests she is armoured with a large [[iron maiden]], attacks by summoning spikes ([[casting spell]]) and launching mechanical [[tendril]]s.

During her phase two the upper sections of the iron maiden opens and reveals her humanoid form, with [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] and [[red eyes]], the only piece of clothing remains on her is the [[spiked headband]] [[headgear]].

The Iron Maiden: Phantom boss version has her relinquishing the iron maiden armor all together.

title: zero_(pgr)
body:
Zero is a NPC from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], she is a mechanoid associated with the Church of Machina under the title 'Lover'.

Zero takes on the look of a female humanoid with very little biological features, she has [[long hair|long]] [[two-tone hair|two-toned]] [[black hair|black]] and [[white hair]], left side black and right side white, in a [[two side up]] style. Has [[red eyes]] and a [[mole under eye|mole under each eye]]. Wears thick [[black eyeliner]] and has a large heart shaped decoration on her chest.

title: lillian_(pgr)
body:
Lillian, a NPC from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]]. She is a Construct and a member of Dark Aries squadron of Babylonia, currently under Commandant [[Simon (pgr)|]].

Lillian takes on the form of a young girl with [[blue eyes]] and [[pink hair]], her hair style is [[two side up]], other style elements are [[crossed bangs]] and [[hair intakes]], wears a [[black hairband]] and her Inver-Device ([[headgear]]) is fitted above her sidelocks on each side. She is otherwise human in appearance, no other mechanical elements.

Her outfit consist of a [[black undershirt]], a [[white shirt|white]] [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[collared shirt]], a [[pink necktie]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[high-waist skirt]] held up by a [[pink belt]].

title: palma_(pgr)
body:
Palma is a NPC from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]]. She is a Construct and the Captain of the Dark Aries squadron of Babylonia, currently under Commandant [[Simon (pgr)|]].

She has [[green eyes]] with [[ringed eyes|rings]], her hair style is [[short hair|short]] [[green hair]] with lime green coloured [[streaked hair|streaks]] and [[colored inner hair|inners]], wears a [[single earring]] on her left ear. Both of her arms are [[mechanical arms|mechanical]] and attached on the bicep area, has exposed [[robot joints|hinge joints]] and [[arm blade]]s attached to them.

Her apparels consist of a [[black bodysuit|black]] [[sleeveless bodysuit]] and a [[see-through apron]].

title: simon_(pgr)
body:
A NPC from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], Simon is a human Commandant of Babylonia graduated from the Academy at the same time as the [[commandant (pgr)|player character]]. After the event of Firn Night he was assigned to lead the team 'Dark Aries', consist of Captain [[Palma (pgr)|]], [[Lillian (pgr)|]] and [[Noan (pgr)|]].

Simon has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]], has [[long bangs]] [[hair over one eye|covering his right eye]], he has [[yellow eyes]] and wears a pair of [[round eyewear|round]] [[glasses]], has a single [[mole under eye|mole under left eye]]. His uniform consist of a [[blue coat|blue]] and [[brown coat]] ([[open coat]]) over a [[blue shirt]]. He is sometimes depicted with [[nausea]] as he suffers from vehicle related motion sickness.

title: celica_(pgr)
body:
Celica is a military officer aboard Babylonia, she assists the player in various capacity both in logistics and combat throughout the story. Serves as the game's tutorial mentor.

h5. Appearance
Celica has [[pink eyes]], [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] tied up in [[twin braids|two braids]], a shorter braid in front and a longer braid on her back, both tied with a [[black ribbon]]. Celica's [[military uniform|uniform]] consist of a [[black headwear|black]] [[beret]], a black [[open jacket|opened]] [[military jacket]] with shoulder [[military rank insignia|rank insignia]], [[detached collar]] and [[dog tags]] around her neck.

title: asimov_(pgr)
body:
Asimov is the head of the Science Council of Babylonia as well as holding a chair in the overall Babylonia council, an exceptional genius for his age, but his rationalist thinking makes him a difficult man to get along with.

h4. Appearance

Asimov has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] often times depicted [[messy]] or [[unkempt]], his eye colour is [[red eyes|red]] and usually have [[bags under eyes]].

Asimov's uniform is mostly white in colour, he wears a [[cloak]] or a [[surcoat]] that covers most of his uniform underneath, the outerwear has [[high collar]]s design.

title: lee_(pgr)
body:
A playable character of [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], a member of the Gray Raven squadron, and the older brother of [[Murray (pgr)|]]. His construct name 'Lee' is derived from the middle syllable of his real name <spoiler>Morian</spoiler>. Voiced by Yoshitsugu Matsuoka.

h4. Appearance

Physical characteristics includes strawberry or sandy [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[short hair]], [[hair between eyes|bangs between eyes]] and [[spiked hair|spiky]] in style. All playable versions of Lee have [[blue eyes]], with the [[lee: hyperreal (pgr)|Hyperreal]] frame having [[glowing eyes|glowing]] blue eyes.

h4. List of playable frames of Lee

* [[lee: palefire (pgr)|Lee: Palefire]]
* [[lee: entropy (pgr)|Lee: Entropy]]
* [[lee: hyperreal (pgr)|Lee: Hyperreal]]

title: murray_(pgr)
body:
Murray is [[Lee (pgr)|]]'s younger brother, a new tactician in the Babylonia military ranks <spoilers>who is later revealed to be the Commandant of the Cerberus team</spoilers>.

h5. Appearance
Murray has [[medium hair|medium length]] [[blonde hair]], often depicted in a full set of [[business suit]] consisting of [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[waistcoat]], [[blue necktie]] and a [[black jacket|black]] [[suit jacket]] with [[notched lapels]] design. He is sometimes depicted [[aged down]] as a [[child]].

title: sharkspeare_(pgr)
body:
Shark-speare is an enemy boss from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]] who also serves as the game's mascot after their debut.

Shark-speare is a [[robot]] [[shark]] (bipedal with four limbs and [[shark tail]]) in a [[yellow coat|yellow]] [[hooded coat|hooded]] [[raincoat]], with his [[hood up]] at all times, its [[shark fin]] is exposed through the hood. Shark-speare is a slightly [[damaged]], and has [[bandaid]]s around the body.

Shark-speare has a second phase form, where the head casing is removed and the internal mechanical head is exposed, clothing becomes [[torn clothes|torned]] and [[mechabare]] becomes visible. Gains two pairs of [[mechanical wings]] and [[thrusters]] and uses its removed head casing as a melee weapon.

title: chiko_(pgr)
body:
Chiko is a NPC from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]]. She is a Construct and the Vice Captain of the Purifying Force of Babylonia.

h5. Appearance
Chiko has [[blue hair]] in a [[bob cut]] style with [[blunt ends]], her eye colour is [[yellow eyes|yellow]]. She wears a [[earpiece]] on her left ear and a [[single earring|single]] [[cross earrings|cross earring]] on her right. Has [[medium breasts]].

Her outfit is a set of smart suits, consist of [[black jacket|black]] [[suit jacket]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] and a [[black necktie]]. Her right arm has armor plating ([[arm armor]] and [[single shoulder pad]]), her left arm has a [[shoulder pouch]]. Wears a [[chest harness]] and it has a [[underbust]] element.

title: villier_(pgr)
body:
Villier  is a NPC from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], he is the brother of [[Qu (pgr)|]] and looks almost indistinguishable from his sister apart from the male style attire and a shorter hair length.

He has [[short hair|short]]/[[medium hair|medium]] length [[black hair]] and [[black eyes]] with [[red eyeliner]], has a [[mole under eye|mole under right eye]]. Typically depicted in [[chinese clothes|Chinese style clothings]] similar to [[hanfu]].

title: lithos_(pgr)
body:
Lithos the Swindler, an enemy boss from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]]. He is an Ascendent of the Ascension Network, working under [[Vonnegut (pgr)|]], he has the appearance of a young girl ([[Otoko no ko]]). His name derives from Ancient Greek λίθος (líthos), meaning 'Stone'.

He has [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] and [[purple eyes]] sometimes depicted as [[empty eyes]], body has exposed [[mechabare]] on his chest and arms, [[robot joints]] on his left knee.

He wears a [[black hairband]] and a distinct 8-petal flower [[hairclip]], bodily apparel consist of a [[black dress|black]] [[medium dress|medium length]] [[sleeveless dress]] with [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[wide sleeves]]. Sometimes depicted with his 'Executioner Chair', a transformable mount that serve the purpose of transportation and combat.

title: scott_pilgrim_(prototype)
body:
Early [[prototype design]] of [[Scott Pilgrim]]. He wears a short-sleeved green shirt and a choker, and has brown eyes unlike the final version's black eyes. 

He is also portrayed as more "cool" compared to the more nerdy and naive final version of Scott.

title: jet
body: See [[fighter jet]] or [[jet airliner]].

title: keke_(kirby)
body: An enemy in the [[Kirby (series)|]] series. It resembles a young, [[grey hair|grey-haired]] witch (sometimes depicted with [[white hair]]) with [[cat ears]] riding on a [[broom]]. In [[Kirby's Dream Land 3]], [[Kirby]] can inhale it to gain the [[cleaning kirby|Cleaning]] [[copy ability]]. h4. See also * [[Broom Hatter]]

title: aya_brea
body: Main protagonist of the [[Parasite Eve (series)|]] series.

title: control_rod_(touhou)
body: What [[Reiuji Utsuho]] wears on her right arm. It resembles a [[cannon]], but is based off of a nuclear control rod. [[zun (artist)|ZUN]] stated that he gave Utsuho an arm cannon to compensate for the three-legged Yatagarasu instead of using an actual third leg.

title: broom_hatter
body: A recurring enemy in the [[Kirby (series)|]] series. It has a yellow body without visible eyes, wears a [[witch hat]], and carries a [[broom]]. In [[Kirby's Dream Land 3]] and [[Kirby: Star Allies]], [[Kirby]] can inhale it to gain the [[cleaning kirby|Cleaning]] [[copy ability]]. h4. See also * [[Keke (kirby)|]]

title: ironmouse_(1st_costume)
body:
The default original costume of [[Ironmouse]], which she used in some fashion from its original debut in 2019, to its replacement with her [[ironmouse (15th costume)|current default]] in 2023. The designs generally referred to as "Season 1" and "Season 2" Ironmouse are included under this tag.

She wears a [[pink shirt]] with [[long sleeves]], a [[black skirt]] a [[single kneehigh|single]] [[white socks|white sock]] and [[single thighhigh|pink thighhighs]], she also wears a [[pink choker|pink]] [[heart choker]], [[heart hair ornament]]s and [[purple footwear|purple]] [[shoes]].

h4. Appearances

* !post #4028735: Season 1 Reference Sheet
* !post #4678630: Season 2 Profile (2D)
* !post #4688940: Season 2 Reference Sheet (3D)

title: ironmouse_(15th_costume)
body:
The 15th and current default [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[VShojo]]'s [[Ironmouse]], as seen in post #5386353 and post #6377569.

Known as her "Season 3" costume, she now wears a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[cropped jacket|cropped]] [[pink jacket]], a [[pink shirt]], a [[half-skirt|half]] [[purple skirt]] [[asymmetrical legwear|asymmetrical]] [[black thighhighs]] and a [[single leg pantyhose|single leg]] [[white pantyhose]] and [[asymmetrical footwear|asymmetrical]] [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]] and [[pink footwear|pink]] [[shoes]]. Unlike her other costume, she has gained [[heterochromia]] with her right eye becoming [[purple eyes|purple]] and her left eye becoming [[red eyes|red]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|hairstyle]], she has [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair|pink]]/[[purple hair|purple]] [[streaked hair]] tied into [[twintails]].

title: rocky_(kirby)
body: A recurring enemy in the [[Kirby (series)|]] series. It is essentially a rock with feet and a blue-and-white [[headband]]. [[Kirby]] can inhale it to gain the [[stone kirby|Stone]] [[copy ability]].

title: ultraman_joneus
body:
The main Ultra of [[The Ultraman (anime)|]]. His human host is Hikari Chouichirou.

Unlike the previous Ultras in the Shouwa era, he hails from the planet U40, instead of Nebula M78.

title: desktop
body: For PC desktops see [[desktop (computing)]]. For the desktop computer itself, see [[computer_tower]].

title: user_interface
body:
Posts depicting a [i]tangibly visible[/i] user interface, that is, a visual layout of various elements that a user might need in order to interact with software or some other technological product. Often features buttons, overlaid text, and/or a list or menu of choices. Older or more technically-oriented user interfaces may instead consist purely of text on a solid color background.

Most game screenshots or spoofs of the same ([[fake screenshot]]s inspired by games) will likely qualify for this tag. 

Avoid using this tag for physical input devices or other mechanical elements if there is no visible "UI screen", even if they might technically qualify as user interfaces (e.g. HID) in a formal sense.

h4. Music/video control

* [[Rewind button]] / [[Fast forward button]]
* [[Play button]] / [[Pause button]]
* [[Volume symbol]]
* [[Shuffle button]]
* [[Repeat button]]

h4. See also
* [[Art program in frame]]
* [[Character select]]
* [[Context menu]]
* [[Desktop (computing)|]]
* [[Dialogue box]]
* [[Gameplay mechanics]]
* [[Heads-up display]]

* [[Interface censor]]
* [[Outside of play area]]
* [[Window (computing)|]]
* [[Visual novel]]
* [[Tag group:drawing software]]

title: desktop_(computing)
body:
The main display area of a computer, which contains [[icon (computing)|]]s and can be customized with a wallpaper of the user's choice.

This tag only applies if the desktop itself is visible - full-screen or zoomed in windows, even if the taskbar is visible, are not the desktop.

h4. See also

* [[Taskbar]]

title: linux
body:
[b]Linux[/b] is a generic term referring to a family of Unix-like [[computer]] operating systems based on the [[GNU]] userland (or others) with the Linux kernel, i.e. GNU/Linux. [[Tux]] is its mascot, and serves as the logo for any distributions based off of the Linux kernel.

The Linux kernel is named after its creator, and current lead maintainer, [[Linus Torvalds]].

h4. See also

title: toki_(senran_kagura)
body:
A character who debuts in [[Senran Kagura New Link]] as the main antagonist, and later becoming an ally character as part of the recently formed Amagi Sealing Congregation.

Toki is a girl with [[very long hair|extremely long]] [[brown hair]] with two [[red hair|red]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] tied in a [[hair ring]] and a [[huge breasts|massive bust]] almost close to [[murasaki (senran kagura)|Murasaki's]]. She wears an elaborate, [[revealing clothes|revealing]] [[white kimono]] with a [[stomach cutout]] revealing her [[navel]] a with red highlights, black stockings, with [[mismatched earrings]] blue on the right and green on a the left, with [[fur trim]] on her waist, with [[detached collar]] with [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[wide sleeves]], with a [[neck tassel]] between her [[cleavage]], with [[black footwear|black]] [[sandals]] and a [[chinese knot]] resemble a flower. Her eyes are blue, with Kagan's signature pink petals replacing her irises.

Her seiyuu is [[Takahashi Rie]]

* "Kagurapedia: Toki":https://senrankagura.fandom.com/wiki/Toki

title: ultraman_cosmos_(eclipse_mode)
body:
[[Ultraman Cosmos]]'s super form, obtained in episode 30 of [[Ultraman Cosmos (series)|]].

This form was achieved after his defeat at the hands of Chaos Header and his revival under a lunar eclipse. This form represents the 'courage' of Musashi which revived Cosmos and combined the powers of Luna and Corona, making it more powerful than either form. It is the only form to require the presence of Musashi. Cosmos can only fight for roughly one minute in this form as it drains a lot of energy.

title: berserk
body:
An ongoing seinen dark fantasy action/horror manga series by [[Miura Kentarou]] that has been adapted into a 25-episode anime, a film trilogy, and summer 2016 TV anime series.

It follows the story of [[Guts (berserk)|]], the Black Swordsman, who wanders the earth fighting off demons that are drawn to the [[Brand of Sacrifice]] mark on his neck. Guts seeks revenge against [[Griffith (berserk)|]], his former best friend, whose betrayal led to the loss of Guts' hand and eye, and nearly everyone he cared about.

Miura passed away on May 6, 2021, leaving the series unfinished.  On June 7, 2022 it was announced that Miura's Studio Gaga under the supervision of Kouji Mori, a close friend of Miura, would resume the series utilizing material left behind or talked about by Miura before his passing.

title: fig_sign
body:
The Fig Sign is a hand gesture made with the hand and fingers curled into a fist and the thumb thrust between the middle and index fingers (or more rarely the middle and ring finger).  While not readily known in the US and many other English speaking countries, the same hand sign is used while playing the children's game I've Got Your Nose. 

The origin of the gesture is unknown and its meaning varies depending on where you are in the world.  In some places the gesture is used for good luck, particularly when used on small decorative hands carved into this gesture that are used as charms, in others, it's used as a mild version of the [[middle finger]] (such as in Russia, where it is called colloquially "кукиш/kukish" or "дуля/dulya", and is seen as a rude way to reject, deny, or dismiss someone).  The meaning of the gesture in the images on Danbooru will commonly mean something akin to "let's fuck."

h4. Examples

* !post #1609687

h4. See also

* [[penetration gesture]]
* [[Tag Group:Gestures]]

title: bossk
body:
Bossk'wassak'Cradossk, known more commonly as Bossk is a [[Star Wars]] character, he was a male Trandoshan bounty hunter and the son of Cradossk who was known for hunting Wookiees. During the Clone Wars, Bossk worked alongside fellow hunters Aurra Sing and Castas to mentor the orphaned [[Boba Fett]]. Their scheme to kill Fett's hated enemy, the Jedi Master [[Mace Windu]], resulted in Fett and Bossk's arrest. 
After the rise of the Empire, Bossk continued to be one of the biggest names in the bounty hunting business despite eventually drifting apart from Fett and working mostly solo. Bossk also took part in hunting Wookiees that were natural enemies of his species, particularly growing a distaste for the [[Wookiee]] [[Chewbacca]] and his partner, the human [[Han Solo]]. Despite just having finished a mission where his last surviving sibling, his sister Doshanalawook, made him swear to stop hunting Wookiees, Bossk was called upon by [[Darth Vader]] to find and capture Solo, Chewbacca, and their ship, the [[Millennium Falcon]].

title: lydia_(skyrim)
body: A character and companion in [[The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim]]. By default, she is a nord woman with [[brown hair|brown]] [[short hair]] with a [[braid]] to the side of it. She is a housecarl who becomes available for the player character to freely hire after completing an early story quest. Despite other followers being obtainable before her availability and her dialogue being shared with any other with the same voice type, her early game attainability, combat viability, and unique sass towards the player has made her memorable among the community.

title: ghost_costume
body:
Any [[costume]] that resembles a [[ghost]]. 

This may consist of [[sheet ghost|a white sheet with eye holes cut out]], or a [[white cloak|white]] [[hooded cloak]]. 

In addition to this, Japanese media often depicts ghosts in Buddhist burial clothing, called shinishozoku. This often includes a simple [[white kimono]] with a collar folded right-over-left to denote death, as well as a white [[triangular headpiece]]. 

Characters might also be depicted alongside floating fire-shaped orbs called [[hitodama]]. The character might be also do a [[ghost pose]] by raising their hands and allowing their wrists to dangle loosely.

h4. Examples
* !post #6809891
* !post #7546914


h4. See also
* [[Halloween costume]]

title: rayman_limbs
body:
When a character's hands or feet float around them as opposed to being physically attached via arms or legs. [[Rayman]] is one of the most iconic characters with this trait, hence the tag's name.

The distinct [[chibi]] style of the [[jikkyou_powerful_pro_yakyuu|Power Pros]] series, and a number of [[Kirby_(series)|]] characters (such as [[Magolor]]) and [[pokemon|Pokémon]]'s [[Haunter]] also feature this limb style.

Please note that [[disembodied hand]] is for limbs without a body. It does not apply to Rayman limbs.

It is currently home to the [[Los Angeles Lakers]] of the [[National Basketball Association]] and the [[Los Angeles Kings]] of the [[National Hockey League]].

title: guimpe
body:
Pronounced 'gyump' - an article of clothing, typically comprised of a [[white collar]] that coveres the neck and shoulders of the wearer, and sometimes the entire chest as well. 

Historically worn by women to represent social standing and modesty. Most often depicted on [[nun]]s.

h4. See also
* [[Puritan collar]]
* [[Wimple]]

title: wimple
body:
A type of headwear that typically covers the head in a similar fashion to a [[detached hood]] - that is, wound snugly around the head, leaving the face bare, but covering the jaw and ears. When worn in this fashion, it is also referred to as a barbette. 

Derived from [[medieval]] times, the wimple is most often seen in depictions of [[traditional nun]]s, where it is worn under a [[veil]], and often attached to a [[guimpe]] - this is a collar, usually white, that covers the shoulders.

h4. Examples
* !post #7578778
* !post #350904
* !post #726
* !post #5629713: A wimple styled into a '[i]cornette[/i]'

title: sen_to_chihiro_no_kamikakushi
body:
A 2001 Japanese animated [[fantasy]] film written and directed by [[miyazaki_hayao_(person)|Miyazaki Hayao]] and produced by [[Studio Ghibli]]. 

Known in America simply as [b]Spirited Away[/b], this movie is about a a shy and timid girl, [[ogino chihiro|Chihiro]], whose family is moving. In the process they visit an abandoned theme park, which turns out to be the entrance to the spirit world. Trapped there, she gets a job at the local bath house, where she learns about the magnificent world of spirits. She is guided by a mysterious boy named [[Haku (sen to chihiro no kamikakushi)|]] as she tries to make her way home.

It garnered the [[the academy awards|Oscar]] for Best Animated Feature in 2003, the first anime movie to win an Oscar.

h4. Characters

title: cel_rendering
body: A technique found in [[3D]] media that mimics the appearance of 2D illustrations. A well-known example is [[The Legend of Zelda]]'s [[the_legend_of_zelda:_breath_of_the_wild|Breath of the Wild]]. In 3D media, cel rendering is typically employed by use of minimalist textures and shaders. This may include hard-edged shadows and highlights, sometimes to a degree that causes visual [[color banding]], and other times, there may be [[flat color|an intentional omission of shadows]] altogether (e.g. [[Untitled Goose Game]]). There may also be use of a prominent outline ([[ookami_(game)|Okami]]), and on the flipside, there may be an [[no lineart|omission of an outline]] altogether. For the 2D cel shading technique, see [[anime coloring]] instead. h4. Media examples Anime * [[ajin_(sakurai_gamon)|Ajin]] * [[BanG Dream!]] * [[Trigun Stampede]] Videogames * [[Jet Set Radio]] * [[shin_subarashiki_kono_sekai|NEO: The World Ends With You]] * [[Ni no Kuni]] * [[The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker]] h4. See also * [[Low poly]]
other_names: トゥーンシェーディング

body:

This [[AV-98 Ingram]] is the [[mecha]] of choice for officer [[Izumi Noa]]. She named her unit [b]"Alphonse"[/b], a name previously held by a [[pet]] [[dog]] and a pet [[cat]], respectively.

It has a number 1 [[roundel]] in its left shoulder.

title: anime_coloring
body:
A 2D rendering technique consisting of hard-edge shading, as opposed to any soft-edge coloring techniques, such as those prominent in [[painterly]] styles. 

It is the most common technique in 2D anime production. 

For the similar technique employed in artworks that are [[3D]] - or that intentionally mimic 3D media - see [[cel rendering]].

title: osana_najimi_(komi-san_wa_komyushou_desu)
body:
A character in [[Komi-san wa Komyushou desu]]. [b]Osana Najimi[/b], a person of [[androgynous|indeterminable gender]] at [[Komi Shouko]]'s high school. Is childhood friends with EVERY student at said school except for Komi herself. Has alternated expressed gender every school year.

They have [[short hair|short]] [[purple hair]] stylized with bangs & [[antenna hair]]. Their [[school uniform]] consists of a [[open jacket|open]] [[blue jacket|blue]] [[blazer]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[striped necktie]], [[diagonal-striped skirt|diagonal-striped]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[loafers]].

h4. External links

* "Komi-san Wiki: Osana Najimi":https://komisan.fandom.com/wiki/Najimi_Osana

title: dugtt_(puyopuyo)
body:
A character from [[Puyopuyo]]. He debuted in [[Puyopuyo Quest]].

He has [[brown eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[blunt ends|blunt]] hair, depicted as either [[red hair|red]] or [[pink hair|pink]].

His default outfit includes a [[short-sleeved jacket|short-sleeved]] [[red jacket]], [[red gloves]], [[black pants]] and [[red footwear|red]] [[shoes]].

h4. Official art

h4. See also

title: neko-tama_(mochimako)
body:
ネコタマ 

[[Original]] characters by [[Mochimako (mushikera Hoi2)|]].  
Six minor [[hitodama]]-like Turn Creatures. They (and [[aqil_ilyas_haddad|Aquil]]) are fed by [[Chloe Fleurage]].

title: monica_blanchflower
body:
モニカ・ブランチフラワー (Monica Blanchflower)

A leading character from "World Crusher", one of [[Mochimako (mushikera Hoi2)|]]'s [[original]] universe/story. 

She was born in Britain and raised in Japan. Although she is a 17 year old third-year high school student, she has smoking habit. She likes [[brand_name_imitation|Madnald]]'s cheeseburger and hates her nickname, "Running [[Rabbit|Bunny]]." She has a close friend, [[Akai Ringo (mochimako)|]] and a brother, [[finn blanchflower|Finn]]. She is a "Transer", who has an ability that can transfer herself from "Trans World" (our earth) to a fantasy world called "Cis world." She and her work-buddy, [[wolger wolfman|Wolger]], who is another main character of this story, are members of "Central Corps."

She is often depicted with [[brown hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her uniform in the Cis world has a kind of [[hoodie]] with [[rabbit ears]].

h4.External Links

* Official profile: http://nobu.boy.jp/c2/monica.htm 
* Her Twitter Bot created by [[Mochimako (mushikera Hoi2)|]]: [s]h[/s][s]ttp://twitter.com/ANWC_monica[/s] (Dead link)
* Twitter Bot's description: [s]h[/s][s]ttp://nobu.boy.jp/bot.htm#moni[/s] (Dead link)

body:
赤飴 りんご (Akai Ringo) 

[[Mochimako (mushikera Hoi2)|]]'s [[original]] character and [[Monica Blanchflower]]'s (single) best friend. Has [[brown eyes]] and [[brown_hair|hair]]. 

h4.See also 

* [[Monica Blanchflower]]

title: frode_grim-reaper
body:
フルーデ・グリムリーパー 

A character from "World Crusher", one of [[Mochimako (mushikera Hoi2)|]]'s [[original]] universe/story. He is [[Chloe Fleurage]]'s sidekick and one of "Turn Creatures", inhabitants of Cis world. These monster-like creatures have abilities to shapeshift (post #1100256 and "#1101324)":[/post/show/1101324/] and boost their masters' combat capability. 

He has two [[horns]], [[wings]], [[extra eyes|multiple eyes]] with a [[blindfold]] and [[sharp teeth]]. 
Like Chloe, he's fond of sweets.

title: annerose_redrum
body:
アンネローゼ・レッドラム (Annerose Redrum)

A character from "World Crusher", one of [[Mochimako (mushikera Hoi2)|]]'s [[original]] universe/story.

She is a 11 years old, always-smiling, doll-like German girl. She has no conscience and is pathologically dependent on her fellow, [[Chloe Fleurage]].

h4.See also

* [[Anneliese Kalkbrenner]]
* [[Kipapa Broken-bear]]

h4.External Links

* Official profile: http://nobu.boy.jp/c2/annerose.htm
* Her Twitter Bot created by [[Mochimako (mushikera Hoi2)|]]: [s][nodtext]http://twitter.com/ANWC_annerose[/nodtext][/s] (Dead link)
* Twitter Bot's description: [s][nodtext]http://nobu.boy.jp/bot.htm#rose[/nodtext][/s] (Dead link)
other_names: アンネローゼ・レッドラム

title: chloe_fleurage
body:
クロエ・フルラージュ (Chloe Fleurage) 

A character from "World Crusher", one of [[Mochimako (mushikera Hoi2)|]]'s [[original]] universe/story. Her nickname is ロエ (Loe). 

She was born in France, raised in New York and currently living in Japan. She is a "Transer", who has an ability that can transfer herself from "Trans World" (our earth) to a fantasy world called "Cis world." She always works alongside her (beloved?) fellow transer, [[Annerose Redrum]]. 

She is often depicted with [[white hair]] and [[red eyes]]. Her uniform in the Cis world has [[striped]] [[single thighhigh]]s, and a [[hoodie]] of some sort. 

h4.See also 

* [[Annerose Redrum]] 
* [[Frode Grim-Reaper]]
* [[Chlosinde Lemoine]] 

h4.External Links 

* Official profile: [s][nodtext]http://nobu.boy.jp/c2/chloe.htm[/nodtext][/s] (Dead link)

* Twitter Bot's description: [s][nodtext]http://nobu.boy.jp/bot.htm#loe[/nodtext][/s] (Dead link)

title: aqil_ilyas_haddad
body:
アーキル・イルヤース・ハッダード (Aqil Ilyas Haddad) 

A character from "World Crusher", one of [[Mochimako (mushikera Hoi2)|]]'s [[original]] universe/story. His nickname is アキ (Aqi/Aki). 

This cynical former child soldier is a member of a Transer team called MiKHAMENTS, led by the super-strong Transer boy Mikhail. [[chloe fleurage|Chloe]] and [[annerose redrum|Annerose]] are his workmates (and roommates). 

h4.External links

* Official profile: http://nobu.boy.jp/c2/aqil.htm

One of [[Mochimako (mushikera Hoi2)|]]'s earliest [[original]] characters. She is also a main character from "Gear of Aeris", one of the artist's original universe/story. Her character profile is filled with 8th grade diseases"[1]":[/wiki_pages/31263#dtext-external-links].

She has [[pink hair|pink]] [[twintails]], [[bandage over one eye]], red [[tattoo]] and [[flat chest]].

body:

They wear a [[yellow bikini]] with [[sequins]], a [[gold]] [[neck ring]] with a [[red gemstone]], a [[shawl]] with [[coin (ornament)|]]s attached, [[see-through pants|partially see-through]] [[white pants|white]] [[harem pants]], a [[red skirt|red]] [[showgirl skirt]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[sandals]].

title: starship_troopers
body:
[i][b]Starship Troopers[/b][/i] is an [[united states|American]] military [[science fiction|science fiction]] novel by "Robert A. Heinlein":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_A._Heinlein , first published (in abridged form) as a serial in [i]The Magazine of Fantasy & Science Fiction[/i] (October, November 1959, as "Starship Soldier") and published hardcover in December, 1959.

The first-person narrative is about a young human soldier of [[philippines|Filipino]] ethnicity named [[johnny_rico|Juan "Johnnie" Rico]] and his exploits in the [[Mobile Infantry]], a futuristic [[military]] unit of [[space marine]]s  equipped with [[power armor]]s and involved in an interstellar war between mankind and an [[arachnid_(starship_troopers)|arachnid]] [[alien]] species known as "the [[Bug]]s".

This book is notable because it was one of the first works of science fiction that introduced the concept of [[power suit]]s. It influenced many sci-fi anime creators and helped to create the [b]Real Robot[/b] genre of piloted [[mecha]] (The creators of [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] from 1979 have cited Starship Troopers as an important inspiration).

In 1988, Sunrise and Bandai Visual produced a 6 episode Japanese OVA adaptation locally titled [[Uchuu No Senshi]].

The most famous and well known adaptation of the book is the 1997 movie adaptation directed by Paul Verhoeven and staring Casper Van Dien, Denise Richards and Neil Patrick Harris. The movie has a mixed reception since some criticized Verhoeven as he never fully read the book and thought the books themes of militarism and patriotism was more like Fascism and portray the human government in the book as Fascists while other praises the movie as a satire of Nationalism and Military Propaganda.

h4. See also

* [[Carmen Ibanez]]
* [[Dizzy Flores]]

title: crux_(constellation)
body:
Crux (the [[Cross]], commonly known as the [i]Southern Cross[/i]) is a [[constellation]] located in the Southern celestial hemisphere. It is the smallest yet one of the most distinguishable constellations. Its brightest star is Acrux.

Crux is an easily recognizable constellation. Its 4 bright stars form a Latin cross '✝' with a slightly tilted horizontal line and a red star on top. It technically has a fifth star that is not connected to the main cross pattern. The constellation lies directly between the "legs" of [[Centaurus (constellation)|]] (the Centaur).

The prominent features of Crux, along with the brightest stars of Centaurus, serve as pointers to the South Celestial Pole. The constellation appears on the flags of [[australian flag|Australia]], [[brazilian flag|Brazil]], [[new zealand flag|New Zealand]], [[papua new guinean flag|Papua New Guinea]] and [[samoan flag|Samoa]].

h4. Examples
* !asset #23246616
* !asset #23245840: Crux and Centaurus
* !post #1676940

h4. Neighboring  constellations
* [[Centaurus (constellation)|]]
* Musca

title: riot_police
body:
Heavily armored [[police]] officers who are called during situations that would present a high risk of danger to the standard police force, such as [[mob]]s, [[rioting|riots]], and other large scale, or potentially highly dangerous small scale events or operations. Often they are called to provide containment or potentially pacify violence.

Commonly depicted with black armor, transparent [[riot shield]]s, and [[face shield|visored]] [[helmet]]s.

title: giant_penguin
body:
Palaeeudyptinae, the giant penguins, are an extinct subfamily of [[penguin|penguins]] known to have existed from the mid-Eocene into the late Oligocene and possibly into the Miocene. Some of its members, such as [[Anthropornis]] and Pachydyptes, are some of the largest penguin species ever known.

Sagittarius has the rough appearance of a stick-figure centaur archer drawing a bow. The brightest stars of the constellation form an asterism known as the [i]Teapot[/i].

title: centaurus_(constellation)
body:
Centaurus (the [[Centaur]]) is a [[constellation]] located in the Southern celestial hemisphere. Its brightest stars are [i]Alpha[/i] and [i]Beta Centauri[/i].

Centaurus, along with [[Sagittarius (constellation)|]], another centaur-associated constellation, has the rough appearance of a stick-figure centaur. Directly to its left lies [[Lupus (constellation)|]] (the Wolf), often interpreted as an animal that has been killed or is about to be killed by the Centaur. And between its "legs" lies [[Crux (constellation)|]], commonly known as the Southern Cross. 

The brightest stars of Centaurus, along with the prominent features of Crux, serve as pointers to the South Celestial Pole.

On December 20th, 2018, actor [[Ryan Reynolds]] published a photograph on [[Instagram]] of himself and actors [[Hugh Jackman]] and Jake Gyllenhaal. In the photograph, Reynolds looks upset and the other two are laughing at him. Reynolds captioned the photograph, "These fucking assholes said it was a sweater party." The post received more than 8.1 million likes in four days.

title: piscis_austrinus_(constellation)
body:
Piscis Austrinus (the Southern [[Fish]]) is a [[constellation]] located in the Southern celestial hemisphere. It was formerly known as Piscis Notius. Its brightest star is Fomalhaut (lit. "mouth of the fish").

Piscis Austrinus is sometimes depicted as being directly connected to [[Aquarius (constellation)|]] (the Water-Bearer) by Fomalhaut, although this star belongs exclusively to Piscis Austrinus. The connection symbolizes the pouring of water from Aquarius into the mouth of the Southern Fish. The constellation used to have a tail running southward, which was later separated into the constellation of [[Grus (constellation)|]] (the Crane).

h4. Examples

title: emperor_penguin
body:
A species of [[penguin]] native to [[Antarctica]]. The tallest and largest of all penguin species. Adults are recognizable by the yellowish feathers around their ears and neck. [[baby penguin|Chicks]] are recognizable by their grey feathers and black heads with white faces.

They can very easily be confused with [[king penguin|king penguins]], however, emperor penguins are significantly taller and the colors around their ears and necks are different.

* !asset #22894021

h4. See also

* [[Emperor Penguin (Kemono Friends)]]

h4. External links

* https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emperor_penguin

title: afterglow
body:
As in "basking in the afterglow" - the warm, glowing feeling of bliss that lingers following [[orgasm]] after engaging in [[happy sex]]. 

For this tag to apply, it should be clear that the affection hasn't really finished, but the physical activity is merely winding down. The persons involved should still emotionally focused on each other, doing things like [[cuddling]], [[spooning]], [[holding hands]], making [[eye contact]], and similar indications of affection, possibly also (literally) [[sleeping]] together through the night. If the partners have disengaged from one another, then the "encounter" really is over, and this tag should not be used.

Contrasted with [[after sex]], which indicates graphic, physical evidence of prior sex, use of [[afterglow]] should be based on the apparent emotional state of those involved. Also note that, while they can coexist, these two tags tend to be mutually exclusive due to reasons of conflicting mood and style.

For the group from [[BanG Dream!]], refer to [[Afterglow (BanG Dream!)]].

H4. See also

* [[couple]]
* [[foreplay]] for similarly passionate gestures and actions before sex

title: aquarius_(constellation)
body:
Aquarius (the Water Bearer) is a [[zodiac]] [[constellation]] located in the Southern celestial hemisphere, between [[Capricorn (constellation)|Capricornus]] to the west and [[Pisces (constellation)|]] to the east. Aquarius is the second largest zodiac constellation after Virgo. Its brightest star is Sadalsuud.

Aquarius is sometimes depicted as being directly connected to [[Piscis Austrinus (constellation)|]] (the Southern Fish) by Fomalhaut, although this star belongs exclusively to Piscis Austrinus. The connection symbolizes the pouring of water from Aquarius into the mouth of the Southern Fish. The Y-shaped star pattern at the top of the constellation forms an asterism called the "Water Jar".

title: scott_pilgrim_takes_off
body:
[i]Scott Pilgrim Takes Off[/i] is an animated adaptation of the [[Scott Pilgrim (series)|]] comic book series by Bryan Lee O'Malley, the second after Titmouse's [i]Scott Pilgrim vs. the Animation[/i] in 2010. The anime was produced by [[Science SARU]] and released on Netflix in November 2023.

It is not actually a retelling of the series; it begins as a straightforward adaptation, but quickly goes into its own plot starring [[Ramona Flowers]].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Scott Pilgrim Takes Off":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scott_Pilgrim_Takes_Off

title: anthropornis
body:
Anthropornis ("man bird") is an extinct genus of giant [[penguin]] ([[giant penguin|Palaeeudyptinae]]) that existed from around the Lutetian stage of the Eocene epoch to the Rupelian stage of the Oligocene. Described from fossils found in the La Meseta Formation on Seymour Island off the [[Antarctica|Antarctic]] coast, they are some of the largest penguins ever known, having reached heights of up to 1.8 metres. The genus comprises two species:

* Anthropornis nordenskjoldi
* Anthropornis grandis

title: millipede
body:
A flattened arthropod with a long, segmented body. Millipedes usually feed on dead or decaying plant matter. Millipedes have a pair of legs on their second through fourth body segments, and two pairs of legs on most following segments. Millipedes defend themselves from attack by coiling up to protect their bodies with their exoskeleton, and by using chemical defenses.

title: chinook_(splatoon)
body:
A type of non-confrontational [[salmonid]] of [[Splatoon (series)|]]'s [[Salmon Run (splatoon)|]]. They accompany the [[Mothership (splatoon)|]] boss during an event-specific wave. They traverses the area in repurposed [[octocopter]] helmets while carrying ice-boxes. These boxes are the main source for [[Golden Egg]] drops if splatted by the freelancer.

If these boxes are not splatted they erupt and revealed to be carriers of lesser salmonids such as [[smallfry (splatoon)|]]s, [[chum (splatoon)|]]s, and [[cohock (splatoon)|]]s.

body:

* !asset #23239251: [[Guqin]] (古琴) 7 strings, lacks frets
* !asset #23232597: [[Guzheng]] (古箏) 16 to 23 or more strings.
* !asset #23244439: [[Kantele]]
* !asset #23238974: [[Koto (instrument)|]] (箏)  Typically 13 strings.

title: udu_(instrument)
body: The kim-kim or Udu is a plosive aerophone (in this case implosive) and an idiophone of the Igbo of Nigeria. In the Igbo language, ùdù means 'vessel' or 'pot'. This is a hand percussion instrument and it is one of the most important instruments in Igbo music.

title: morin_khuur
body: The morin khuur (Mongolian: морин хуур) also known as the horsehead fiddle, is a traditional Mongolian bowed stringed instrument. It is one of the most important musical instruments of the [[mongolia|Mongol]] people, and is considered a symbol of the nation of Mongolia.

title: grand_piano
body:
A type of acoustic [[piano]] whose strings, frame and soundboard are laid out horizontally. Can be found in varying lengths between roughly five and ten feet, from the keyboard at one end to the tail at the other. Such an instrument carries a much larger footprint than an upright piano or spinet, but makes a much greater sonic and visual impact.

Occasionally, an electric or digital piano will be mounted in a grand piano-shaped [i]case[/i], such as found at post #527947.

H4. Examples 
* !asset #23242107: "source: Wikimedia":[https://commons.m.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Steinway_%26_Sons_concert_grand_piano,_model_D-274,_manufactured_at_Steinway%27s_factory_in_Hamburg,_Germany.png]

title: race_queen
body:
A model usually present at auto racing events. They are typically seen wearing skimpy outfits bearing the logos of the racing team and/or its sponsors. Their official job is to hold a [[parasol]] over the driver to shield them from sunlight while their car is being worked on. Also known as a [i]grid girl[/i] or [i]umbrella girl[/i].

The term [i]race queen[/i] can be used interchangeably with the terms [i]campaign girl[/i] and [i][[booth babe]][/i] as all refer to models in skimpy outfits. Campaign girls can be seen more in trade shows and the like, specially those that market [[motor vehicle]]s, while booth babes are seen in smaller booths, especially acting as booth tenders or helpers.

Due to the increased presence of women in motorsports and safety concerns regarding their outfits in pit lanes, race queens have been phased out of almost all major motorsport series, with [[Super GT]], [[Moto GP]], and [[Deutsche Tourenwagen Masters]] being notable holdouts - DTM even offering the option for male pit models to accompany female drivers.

The most recognizable form of race queen outfit is a revealing outfit usually consisting of a [[crop top]] or [[tube top]] with a [[skirt]] or [[shorts]], designed to highlight the model's [[midriff]] and legs, although [[highleg leotard]]s and [[highleg_one-piece_swimsuit|swimsuits]] with or without additional accessories have also been common as outfits especially during the 1990s in Japan. Recently, race queens in less revealing outfits have also become more common, primarily in regions outside of Japan that still employ them - their outfits will usually consist of form-fitting [[dress]]es or [[bodysuit]]s instead. 

h4. Examples
* !post #97431: A typical race queen outfit
* !post #2246767: Racing PIAA race queen wearing a white leotard/one-piece swimsuit with sash
* !post #3122297: [[Pacific Racing Team]]'s 2015 race queen outfit
* !post #6638123: [[Racing Project Bandoh]]'s 2024 race queen outfit with a [[bodystocking]]
* !asset #21090138: [[Sawa Sumire]], a [[real life]] race queen in [[Autobacs Racing Team Aguri]]'s 2022 outfit

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Race queen":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Race_queen

title: bolt_action
body:
A type of [[gun]] mechanism by which the shooter has to manually cycle the action to chamber a new [[cartridge|round]] for each time they need to shoot, by [b]directly moving the bolt[/b] via a [b]bolt handle[/b] (also known as a cocking handle). The earliest example of bolt-action gun that is fielded by an military is the Prussian [[Dreyse needle gun]]

Most bolt action weapons are [[rifle]]s. The [[Welrod]] is an example of a bolt action pistol.

* [[Welrod]]

title: fullmetal_alchemist
body:
[b]Fullmetal Alchemist[/b] ([i]Hagane no Renkinjutsushi[/i]) is a Japanese [[Steampunk]] manga series written and illustrated by [[Arakawa Hiromu]], with two anime adaptations made by Bones studio.

After a failed attempt to resurrect their dead mother via alchemy, [[Edward Elric]] lost his left leg, while his younger brother [[Alphonse Elric|Alphonse]] lost his entire body, forcing the former to sacrifice his right arm to affix Alphonse's soul into a suit of armor. After gaining [[automail]] prosthetics from childhood friend and mechanic [[Winry Rockbell]], Edward enlists into the Amestris State Military to seek the Philosopher's Stone, hoping to restore their bodies, unaware of its secrets.

title: kiana_kaslana_(void_drifter)
body:
One of the playable Valkyria [[official alternate costume|outfits]] of [[Honkai Impact 3rd]]'s [[Kiana Kaslana]]. 

The base Void Drifter outfit consists of a [[black dress]] with a white breast-side top, [[white belt]], [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves|elbow glove]] on her right arm, [[white gloves|white glove]] on her left hand, [[black jacket|black]] [[cropped jacket]] worn [[jacket on shoulders|on her shoulders]], [[single thighhigh|single]] [[black thighhighs|black thighhigh]] on her right leg, [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]], and an orange spiked [[hair ornament]] on her left side. 

She has one variant of the outfit, named "Radiant Blaze". 

h4. Appearance

title: katsuragi_(kancolle)
body:
[i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Katsuragi[/i], introduced in the April 2015 event. 
Character design by [[Kuuro Kuro]], voiced by [[Kayano Ai]].

She is portrayed with [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]], [[white ribbon|white]] [[hair ribbon]], [[blue eyes]], and a [[flat chest]]. Her base outfit consists of a green [[furisode]] with orange [[camouflage]] patterns, [[green sash|green]] [[obi]] with her real-life flight deck camouflage pattern, [[white shirt]] top, [[muneate]] patterned off her real-life bow, white [[fundoshi]], and [[green footwear|green]] [[platform footwear]]. 

In her kai form, she disposes of the kimono entirely, and wears a [[pleated skirt]], [[uneven gloves|asymmetric]] [[fingerless gloves]], with one being [[elbow_gloves|an elbow glove]], and [[black thighhighs]] to create [[zettai ryouiki]]. 

She is a huge admirer of [[Zuikaku (kancolle)|]] and frequently calls her senpai. At the time of Katsuragi's completion, Zuikaku was the only remaining standard aircraft carrier in the IJN apart from the Unryuu-class. 

h4. Skins

* !post #1996997: Base
* !post #1997016: [[Katsuragi Kai (kancolle)|]]

h4. [i]Unryuu[/i]-class aircraft carriers
* [[Unryuu (Kancolle)|]]
* [[Amagi (Kancolle)|]]
* [b]Katsuragi[/b]

h4. See also
* [[Katsuragi (Azur Lane)]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: IJN [i]Katsuragi[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_aircraft_carrier_Katsuragi]
* "Kantai Collection Wiki: Katsuragi":[http://kancolle.wikia.com/wiki/Katsuragi]
other_names: 葛城(艦隊これくしょん)

title: hush_(the_binding_of_isaac)
body: One of many superbosses in [[The Binding of Isaac]]. Unlocked by defeating Mom's Heart at least 10 times, he can only be accessed by defeating said Heart (or It Lives!) within 30 minutes of the current run. What follows is not just a fight with [[???_(the_binding_of_isaac)|???]], but also a hidden second phase where he grows into a [[kaiju]] and fights [[isaac_(the_binding_of_isaac)|Isaac]] with [[danmaku]] and various hordes of monsters.

title: venti_(genshin_impact)
body:
A playable Anemo character in [[Genshin Impact]].

A [[bard]] that seems to have arrived on some unknown wind — sometimes sings songs as old as the hills, and other times sings poems fresh and new.

His true identity is the human form of the Anemo Archon [[Barbatos (genshin impact)|]]. His [[Vision (genshin impact)|]] is just a glass ball he carries around to alleviate suspicion.

He has a similar appearance to the [[Nameless Bard (genshin impact)|]], whose guise he took after becoming the Anemo Archon, as well as to [[Wendy (Honkai Impact)|]] from [[Honkai Impact 3rd]].

His signature weapon is [[Elegy of the End (Genshin Impact)|Elegy of the End]].

h4. Appearance

He has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] with [[twin braids]]. In his default outfit he wears a [[green hat|green]] [[beret]], [[green cape|cape]], and [[green shorts|shorts]], with [[white pantyhose]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[loafers]]. He carries a [[lyre]].

In his [[Venti (Archon) (Genshin Impact)|Archon]] form he wears a very revealing [[midriff]]-exposing [[crop top]] and a [[hooded capelet]]. He also wears elbow-length [[bridal gauntlets]], along with [[short shorts]] and a [[single thighhigh]]. The outfit is overall predominantly white. He also has white [[feathered wings]].

h4. Official art
